column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Perform an Orbital Transfer
#Text=An orbital transfer is a maneuver used to change the height of your orbit around a planet , moon or other body .
#Text=Although you 'll probably never need to use this knowledge in real life , it comes in very handy if you 're using a simulator like the Kerbal Space Program .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Raising Your Orbit with a Hohmann Transfer
#Text=Decide if you should use a Hohmann transfer .
#Text=In general , you should use a Hohmann transfer if : desired radius/current radius < 11.95 .
#Text=When you reach your periapsis ( the lowest point of your orbit ) , burn prograde ( in the direction of travel ) .
#Text=This has the effect of raising your apoapsis ( the highest point of your orbit ) .
#Text=Burn until your apoapsis reaches the height of your desired orbit .
#Text=You can calculate the delta-v for this burn using the formula in the picture .
#Text=When you reach apoapsis , burn prograde until your periapsis reaches the desired height .
#Text=This should cause your orbit to circularise .
#Text=Again , you can use the equation to calculate the delta-v for this burn .
#Text=Raising Your Orbit with a Bi-Elliptical Transfer
#Text=Decide if you should use a bi-elliptical transfer .
#Text=You should use this method if : desired radius/current radius > 11.95
#Text=When you reach periapsis , burn prograde until your apoapsis is near the edge of the planet 's sphere of influence .
#Text=When you reach apoapsis , burn prograde until your periapsis reaches the height of the desired orbit .
#Text=Use a low thrust for this , it wo n't need much delta-v .
#Text=When you reach periapsis , burn retrograde ( opposite the direction of motion ) until your apoapsis falls to the height of the desired orbit .
#Text=Lowering Your Orbit with a Hohmann Transfer
#Text=When you reach apoapsis , burn retrograde until your periapsis reaches the height of the desired orbit .
#Text=You can use the equations from method one to calculate the delta-v for this and the next step .
#Text=When you reach periapsis , burn retrograde until your apoapsis falls to the height of the desired orbit .
#Text=Lowering Your Orbit with a Bi-Elliptical Transfer
#Text=When you reach periapsis , burn prograde until your apoapsis is near the edge of the planet 's sphere of influence .
#Text=You can use the equations from method two to calculate the delta-v needed for these steps .
#Text=When you reach apoapsis , burn retrograde until your periapsis reaches the desired height .
#Text=When you reach periapsis , burn retrograde until your apoapsis falls to the height of the desired orbit .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Periapsis : the lowest point of your orbit
#Text=Apoapsis : the highest point of your orbit
#Text=Prograde : the direction in which you are moving ( not necessarily the direction in which you are facing )
#Text=Retrograde : opposite the direction in which you are moving
#Text=Sphere of influence : the zone of space in which the gravity of a body is dominant over other gravity sources .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=When performing a bi-elliptical transfer , make sure that your apoapsis does n't leave the planet 's sphere of influence !
#Text=If it does , you 'll escape the planet 's gravity and go flying off into space .
